result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Dallas Montgomery

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
4:03 PM Cases 22CF197, 22TR630, and 22TR631 called together.  Defendant Andrew Dallas Montgomery appeared by video.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Andrew Dallas Montgomery.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information. Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Court inquires- is def doing IDIP or equivalent; def is doing Rock County IDIP.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017404,
Payable Number: 77583,
Receipt Number: 22R 004282,
Amount: $20.00

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:07 AM Cases 22CF197, 22TR630, and 22TR631 called together.  Defendant Andrew Dallas Montgomery appeared by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney, Philip Brehm, appears specially today by video.  Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Court willing to allow defense to appear via video for preliminary hearing if def makes proper waiver.  Court informs defense about IDIP program equivalent option, gives coordinator's contact information.  Def pleads NG to the TR matters.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
